greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Take pairs (a, b), sorted on a, such that T(a)+T(b)=concatenation of a and b, where T(k) is the k-th triangular number A000217(k). Sequence gives values of b.
comment: For values of a see A096031.

It is easier to generate the pairs sorted by b. A d-digit number b is a member iff 4*(10^(2*d)-10^d-b^2+b)+1 is a square. All such b occur twice, except for 1, which occurs once. There are no members with 2, 6, 7, or 8 digits. There are six distinct nine-digit members. - _David Wasserman_, May 15 2007
reference: J. S. Madachy, Madachy's Mathematical Recreations, pp. 166 Dover NY 1979.
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..294
example: 1726 of the sequence forms a pair with 150 and we indeed have T(150)+T(1726)=11325+1490401=1501726.
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{k = n + 1, t1 = n(n + 1)/2, td = IntegerDigits[n]}, While[k < 15*n && t1 + k(k + 1)/2 != FromDigits[ Join[ td, IntegerDigits[k]]], k++ ]; If[k != 15*n, k, 0]]; Do[ k = f[n]; If[k != 0, Print[n, " & ", k]], {n, 10^6}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 21 2004 *)
results.author: _Lekraj Beedassy_, Jun 16 2004
ext: Two more terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 21 2004
Terms from a(19) onwards from _David Wasserman_, May 15 2007
